deepof.post_hoc moduleÔÉÅ

Data structures and functions for analyzing supervised and unsupervised model results.

deepof.post_hoc.get_time_on_cluster(soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, normalize: bool = True, reduce_dim: bool = False)ÔÉÅ

Given a set of cluster assignments and the corresponding breaks, computes how much each animal spent on each cluster.

Parameters

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions (experimental) ‚Äì

  • condition. (each) ‚Äì

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • normalize (bool) ‚Äì Whether to normalize the time by the total number of frames in

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • reduce_dim (bool) ‚Äì Whether to reduce the dimensionality of the embeddings to 2D. If False,

  • dimensionality. (the embeddings are kept in their original) ‚Äì

Returns

A dataframe with the time spent on each cluster for each experiment.

deepof.post_hoc.get_aggregated_embedding(embedding: deepof_table_dict, reduce_dim: bool = False, agg: str = 'mean')ÔÉÅ

Aggregates the embeddings of a set of videos, using the specified aggregation method. Instead of an embedding per chunk, the function returns an embedding per experiment.

Parameters

  • embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions (experimental) ‚Äì

  • condition. (and the values are the embeddings for each) ‚Äì

  • reduce_dim (bool) ‚Äì Whether to reduce the dimensionality of the embeddings to 2D. If False,

  • dimensionality. (the embeddings are kept in their original) ‚Äì

  • agg (str) ‚Äì The aggregation method to use. Can be either ‚Äúmean‚Äù or ‚Äúmedian‚Äù.

Returns

A dataframe with the aggregated embeddings for each experiment.

deepof.post_hoc.select_time_bin(embedding: deepof_table_dict, soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, bin_size: int, bin_index: int)ÔÉÅ

Selects a time bin and filters all relevant objects (embeddings, soft_counts and breaks).

Parameters

  • embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions (experimental) ‚Äì

  • condition. (and the values are the breaks for each) ‚Äì

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • bin_size (int) ‚Äì The size of the time bin to select.

  • bin_index (int) ‚Äì The index of the time bin to select.

Returns

A tuple of the filtered embeddings, soft counts, and breaks.

deepof.post_hoc.condition_distance_binning(embedding: deepof_table_dict, soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, exp_conditions: dict, start_bin: int, end_bin: int, step_bin: int, scan_mode: str = 'growing-window', agg: str = 'mean', metric: str = 'auc', n_jobs: int = 10)ÔÉÅ

Computes the distance between the embeddings of two conditions, using the specified aggregation method.

Parameters

  • embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions (experimental) ‚Äì

  • condition. (and the values are the breaks for each) ‚Äì

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of experimental conditions, where the keys are the

  • experiments (names of the) ‚Äì

  • corresponding (and the values are the names of their) ‚Äì

  • conditions. (experimental) ‚Äì

  • start_bin (int) ‚Äì The index of the first bin to compute the distance for.

  • end_bin (int) ‚Äì The index of the last bin to compute the distance for.

  • step_bin (int) ‚Äì The step size of the bins to compute the distance for.

  • scan_mode (str) ‚Äì The mode to use for computing the distance. Can be either ‚Äúgrowing-window‚Äù

  • discriminability ((used to select optimal binning) or "per-bin" (used to evaluate how) ‚Äì

  • size). (evolves in subsequent bins of a specified) ‚Äì

  • agg (str) ‚Äì The aggregation method to use. Can be either ‚Äúmean‚Äù, ‚Äúmedian‚Äù, or ‚Äútime_on_cluster‚Äù.

  • metric (str) ‚Äì The distance metric to use. Can be either ‚Äúauc‚Äù (where the reported ‚Äòdistance‚Äô

  • embeddings) (is based on performance of a classifier when separating aggregated) ‚Äì

  • or ‚Äì

  • "wasserstein" (which computes distances based on optimal transport) ‚Äì

  • n_jobs (int) ‚Äì The number of jobs to use for parallel processing.

Returns

An array with distances between conditions across the resulting time bins

deepof.post_hoc.separation_between_conditions(cur_embedding: deepof_table_dict, cur_soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, cur_breaks: deepof_table_dict, exp_conditions: dict, agg: str, metric: str)ÔÉÅ

Computes the distance between the embeddings of two conditions, using the specified aggregation method.

Parameters

  • cur_embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions (experimental) ‚Äì

  • condition. (and the values are the breaks for each) ‚Äì

  • cur_soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • cur_breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of experimental conditions, where the keys are the

  • experiments (names of the) ‚Äì

  • corresponding (and the values are the names of their) ‚Äì

  • conditions. (experimental) ‚Äì

  • agg (str) ‚Äì The aggregation method to use. Can be one of ‚Äútime on cluster‚Äù, ‚Äúmean‚Äù, or ‚Äúmedian‚Äù.

  • metric (str) ‚Äì The distance metric to use. Can be either ‚Äúauc‚Äù (where the reported ‚Äòdistance‚Äô

  • embeddings) (is based on performance of a classifier when separating aggregated) ‚Äì

  • or ‚Äì

  • "wasserstein" (which computes distances based on optimal transport) ‚Äì

Returns

The distance between the embeddings of the two conditions.

deepof.post_hoc.cluster_enrichment_across_conditions(embedding: deepof_table_dict, soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, exp_conditions: dict, bin_size: Optional[int] = None, bin_index: Optional[int] = None, normalize: bool = False)ÔÉÅ

Computes the population of each cluster across conditions.

Parameters

  • embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions (experimental) ‚Äì

  • condition. (and the values are the breaks for each) ‚Äì

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of experimental conditions, where the keys are the

  • experiments (names of the) ‚Äì

  • corresponding (and the values are the names of their) ‚Äì

  • conditions. (experimental) ‚Äì

  • bin_size (int) ‚Äì The size of the time bins to use. If None, the embeddings are not binned.

  • bin_index (int) ‚Äì The index of the bin to use. If None, the embeddings are not binned.

  • normalize (bool) ‚Äì Whether to normalize the population of each cluster across conditions.

Returns

A long format dataframe with the population of each cluster across conditions.

deepof.post_hoc.get_transitions(state_sequence: list, n_states: int)ÔÉÅ

Computes the transitions between states in a state sequence.

Parameters

  • state_sequence (list) ‚Äì A list of states.

  • n_states (int) ‚Äì The number of states.

Returns

The resulting transition matrix.

deepof.post_hoc.compute_transition_matrix_per_condition(embedding: deepof_table_dict, soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, exp_conditions: dict, bin_size: Optional[int] = None, bin_index: Optional[int] = None, aggregate: str = True, normalize: str = True)ÔÉÅ

Computes the transition matrices specific to each condition.

Parameters

  • embedding (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of embeddings, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions (experimental) ‚Äì

  • condition. (and the values are the breaks for each) ‚Äì

  • soft_counts (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of soft counts, where the keys are the names of the

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • breaks (TableDict) ‚Äì A dictionary of breaks, where the keys are the names of the experimental

  • conditions ‚Äì

  • condition. ‚Äì

  • exp_conditions (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of experimental conditions, where the keys are the

  • experiments (names of the) ‚Äì

  • corresponding (and the values are the names of their) ‚Äì

  • bin_size (int) ‚Äì The size of the time bins to use. If None, the embeddings are not binned.

  • bin_index (int) ‚Äì The index of the bin to use. If None, the embeddings are not binned.

  • aggregate (str) ‚Äì Whether to aggregate the embeddings across time.

  • normalize (str) ‚Äì Whether to normalize the population of each cluster across conditions.

Returns

A dictionary of transition matrices, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the transition matrices for each condition.

deepof.post_hoc.compute_steady_state(transition_matrices: dict, return_entropy: bool = False, n_iters: int = 100000)ÔÉÅ

Computes the steady state of each transition matrix provided in a dictionary.

Parameters

  • transition_matrices (dict) ‚Äì A dictionary of transition matrices, where the keys are

  • conditions (the names of the experimental) ‚Äì

  • condition. (and the values are the transition matrices for each) ‚Äì

  • return_entropy (bool) ‚Äì Whether to return the entropy of the steady state. If False, the steady states themselves are

  • returned. ‚Äì

  • n_iters (int) ‚Äì The number of iterations to use for the Markov chain.

Returns

A dictionary of steady states, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the steady states for each condition. If return_entropy is True, values correspond to the entropy of each steady state.

deepof.post_hoc.align_deepof_kinematics_with_unsupervised_labels(deepof_project: deepof_project, kin_derivative: int = 1, include_distances: bool = True, include_angles: bool = True, include_areas: bool = True, animal_id: Optional[str] = None)ÔÉÅ

In order to annotate time chunks with as many relevant features as possible, this function aligns the kinematics of a deepof project (speed and acceleration of body parts, distances, and angles) with the hard cluster assignments obtained from the unsupervised pipeline.

Parameters

  • deepof_project (Project) ‚Äì A deepof.Project object.

  • kin_derivative (int) ‚Äì The order of the derivative to use for the kinematics. 1 = speed, 2 = acceleration, etc.

  • include_distances (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include distances in the alignment. kin_derivative is taken into account.

  • include_angles (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include angles in the alignment. kin_derivative is taken into account.

  • include_areas (bool) ‚Äì Whether to include areas in the alignment. kin_derivative is taken into account.

  • animal_id (str) ‚Äì The animal ID to use, in case of multi-animal projects.

Returns

A dictionary of aligned kinematics, where the keys are the names of the experimental conditions, and the values are the aligned kinematics for each condition.

deepof.post_hoc.chunk_summary_statistics(chunked_dataset: ndarray, body_part_names: list)ÔÉÅ

Extracts summary statistics from a chunked dataset using seglearn.

Parameters

  • chunked_dataset (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Preprocessed training set (of shape chunks x time x features),

  • data. (where each entry corresponds to a time chunk of) ‚Äì

  • body_part_names (list) ‚Äì A list of the names of the body parts.

Returns

A dataframe of kinematic features, of shape chunks by features.

deepof.post_hoc.annotate_time_chunks(deepof_project: deepof_project, soft_counts: deepof_table_dict, breaks: deepof_table_dict, supervised_annotations: Optional[deepof_table_dict] = None, animal_id: Optional[str] = None, kin_derivative: int = 1, include_distances: bool = True, include_angles: bool = True, include_areas: bool = True, aggregate: str = 'seglearn')ÔÉÅ

Annotate time chunks produced after change-point detection using the unsupervised pipeline, using a set of summary statistics coming from kinematics, distances, angles, and supervised labels when provided.

Parameters

  • deepof_project ‚Äì deepof.data.Project object.

  • soft_counts ‚Äì matrix with soft cluster assignments produced by the unsupervised pipeline.

  • breaks ‚Äì the breaks for each condition.

  • supervised_annotations ‚Äì set of supervised annotations produced by the supervised pipeline withing deepof.

  • animal_id ‚Äì The animal ID to use, in case of multi-animal projects.

  • kin_derivative ‚Äì The order of the derivative to use for the kinematics. 1 = speed, 2 = acceleration, etc.

  • include_distances ‚Äì Whether to include distances in the alignment. kin_derivative is taken into account.

  • include_angles ‚Äì Whether to include angles in the alignment. kin_derivative is taken into account.

  • include_areas ‚Äì Whether to include areas in the alignment. kin_derivative is taken into account.

  • aggregate ‚Äì aggregation mode. Can be either ‚Äúmean‚Äù (computationally cheapest), just use the average per feature,

  • series. (or "seglearn" which runs a thorough feature extraction and selection pipeline on each time) ‚Äì

Returns

A dataframe of kinematic features, of shape chunks by features.

deepof.post_hoc.chunk_cv_splitter(chunk_stats: ndarray, breaks: ndarray, n_folds: int = 10, qual_filter: Optional[ndarray] = None)ÔÉÅ

Given a matrix with extracted features per chunk, returns a list containing a set of cross-validation folds, grouped by experimental video. This makes sure that chunks coming from the same experiment will never be leaked between training and testing sets.

Parameters

  • chunk_stats ‚Äì matrix with statistics per chunk, sorted by experiment

  • breaks ‚Äì dictionary containing ruprures per video

  • n_folds ‚Äì number of cross-validation folds to compute

  • qual_filter ‚Äì quality filter to use for the cross-validation. If None, no filter is used.

Returns

list containing a training and testing set per CV fold.
